Package com.cscie97.store.ledger

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cscie97.store.ledger.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    - Tofik Mussa This represents a block which contains a maximum of 10 transactions and is linked to the block created before it with the previousHash attribute. Transactions passing validations are added to the block object and it also contains all of the accounts that has been created leading up to it keyed by their unique address.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • generateHash

        public java.lang.String generateHash​(java.lang.String seed)
        The serializable interface is implemented. All of the attributes except the hash field itself are used to generate the hash. The seed is used as salt. Lines 55 - 57 are burrowed from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5531455/how-to-hash-some-string-with-sha256-in-java
        Parameters:
        seed -
        Returns:
        the generated hash

      • getHash

        public java.lang.String getHash()

      • setHash

        public void setHash​(java.lang.String hash)
        Parameters:
        hash - This is used to set the generated hash once transaction limit is reached. The hash is being computed only when the Ledger is ready to move forward with the next block

      • getBlockNumber

        public int getBlockNumber()

      • getPreviousHash

        public java.lang.String getPreviousHash()
        No setter for previousHash to enforce immutability once block is created
        Returns:
        the previous hash

      • setBlockNumber

        public void setBlockNumber​(int blockNumber)
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - With the exception of the genesisBlock which gets reset to 1, all block's blockNumber is set to the previous block's blockNumber incremented by 1

        public void setAccountBalanceMap​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Account> accountBalanceMap)
        Parameters:
        accountBalanceMap - This is used to pass the current accountBalanceMap to the next block once transaction limit is reached

      • addsNewAccountToAccountBalanceMap

        public void addsNewAccountToAccountBalanceMap​(Account account)
        Parameters:
        account - Adds account to accountBalanceMap

      • increaseAccountBalance

        public void increaseAccountBalance​(java.lang.String address,
                                   int balanceToAdd)
        This method increases account balance by the requested amount. The account's setter method throws exception for invalid amounts(say if new balance exceeds Integer.MAX_VAlUE). It replace the account entry in the map with the one with updated balance if passing validation
        Parameters:
        address -
        balanceToAdd -
        Throws:
        LedgerException

      • decreaseAccountBalance

        public void decreaseAccountBalance​(java.lang.String address,
                                   int balanceToDeduct)
        This method decreases account balance by the requested amount. The account's setter method throws exception for invalid amounts(say if new balance becomes below zero). It replace the account entry in the map with the one with updated balance if passing validation
        Parameters:
        address -
        balanceToDeduct -
        Throws:
        LedgerException
